required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Imsidolimab (ANB019) in the Treatment of Subjects With Hidradenitis Suppurativa
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Imsidolimab (ANB019) in the Treatment of Subjects With Hidradenitis Suppurativa

brief_summary.textblock: Efficacy and Safety of Imsidolimab (ANB019) in Subjects with Hidradenitis Suppurativa

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase 2, multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of imsidolimab in adult subjects with hidradenitis suppurativa (HS). This study also will characterize the pharmacokinetic (PK) profile of imsidolimab and explore the immune response to imsidolimab in subjects with HS.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the efficacy of imsidolimab in subjects with HS
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in baseline in abscess and inflammatory nodule (AN) count at Week 16
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of imsidolimab in subjects with HS and compare with placebo change from Baseline in abscess and inflammatory nodule (AN) count at Week 16

arm_group.arm_group_label: ANB019 Biological Humanized Monoclonal Antibody Low Dose
ANB019 Biological Humanized Monoclonal Antibody High Dose

intervention.arm_group_label: ANB019 Biological Humanized Monoclonal Antibody High Dose
ANB019 Biological Humanized Monoclonal Antibody Low Dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female aged 18 to 75 years (inclusive) at the time of signing informed consent.
2. Clinically confirmed diagnosis of active HS with a disease duration of ≥ 6 months before Day 1.
3. HS lesions present in at least 2 distinct anatomical areas.
4. Total AN count ≥ 5.
5. Draining fistulas ≤ 20.
6. Stable HS for at least 6 weeks prior to Day 1 visit.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Concomitant dermatological or medical conditions that may interfere with the Investigators' ability to evaluate the subject's response to therapy.
